article:
Jody was ten years old when he decided he needed a job. He thought it might be  _  to raise worms. He could sell them to farmers and people who fished. So in  _  , he bought many worms. But that winter the cold weather killed all the worms because he had not  _  them in a warm place.
The next spring Jody  _  again. He bought more worms, which he took good care of. When winter came, he took them inside  _  they would stay warm. Many people bought his worms.
One day when Jody was twelve, he got a letter. It was from state of New York. The letter said, "Everyone who  _  things has to pay taxes!" Jody made only one dollar selling worms. But he still  _  to pay part of that money to the state. He told many people in his town what had   _  . Soon some people from a television station  _  with Jody. Many people saw it and they began to write letters to the state. The letters now said that the law was  _  . Finally the law was changed. Children like Jody can now sell things without paying money to the state.
